text:
Hi Folks,
i can't find a way to create a clone of the "Elevate Theme", i've read somewhere that it's still in beta and can not be cloned.
Doe's anyone have cloned the Theme yet ?

Hey <@U07AH2ENYTF>, never heard of this theme. But if it's a theme from the marketplace(and therefore in the @marketplace folder), you can right-click and select "Create Child-theme".
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/guides/cms/content/themes/child-themes|Child-themes> are the recommended approach for modifying and extending a marketplace theme.
Hi <@UJAPS2K4N>, unfortunately its not from the marketplace, i can search it up in the design manager, but cannot open a file or clone it.
it is also described as a HubSpot theme
hmm. It's in the `@HubSpot folder` . Checked a few of my portals and can't find it. Where/how did you get it?
it's seems like its in the HubSpot folder because the search says so, but i can't find it, even when i create a new page i can select the theme

You're right. Very strange. When I search for it, I can see it as a result, but right-clicking on the tab and selecting "Reveal in Finder" doesn't do anything.
<@U7SL518D6>, <@UQWGKUEN7> do you guys know anything about the "Elevate" Theme?

Cant find it via `Reveal in Finder` but via Search > it is there
• did find it comes from `Build a CMS theme using projects`
    ◦ <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/guides/cms/content/themes/build-and-deploy-with-projects> 
        ▪︎ can download then customize via CLI

Hey hey - Elevate is the new HubSpot default theme. Soon to be replacing Growth entirely. You don’t see it in DM because it’s actually built using projects as it’s making use of react modules. 

There are some technical difficulties with surfacing it in DM and we are working on making a more cohesive experience with regards to being able to find it. 

For the time being the following document is a good overview of project based themes. And shows you how to get elevate via the cli. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/guides/cms/content/themes/build-and-deploy-with-projects|https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/guides/cms/content/themes/build-and-deploy-with-projects>
Lots changing on this frontier quite often.
Thanks for enlighten us, <@UQWGKUEN7> :rocket:
Heck yea — Def some good stuff in there too! So worth poking around. React is def changing HS development imo.
This is pretty sick, good to seeing react getting more usage these days
Maybe a dumb question - would you still be able to create a child theme since it's not in DM? Assuming you still could with CLI, but currently you can do that with Growth in DM
Currently you can't create child themes for Project based themes

Not a dumb question — Honestly it’s a bit of a gray area.  You will need to deploy elevate as a project. Because it’s created as a new project it will technically be it’s own standalone thing.

This is another area that we are exploring. However, we saw the benefit of being able to build an entire theme as a project and keep react modules coupled with the theme more of a benefit to the general public than having the child theme capability worked out. These are 2 very very different pipelines in terms of building and serving assets.
Quite interesting, would love to spend more time with HS+React 100%
Would love to discuss some thoughts in a more private round :slightly_smiling_face:
Ah, that helps, thank you, I haven't had a lot of exposure with projects yet
I've also yet to experiment, I think we should do a group theme build out with projects

If youre building themes regularly I def recommend looking into building with this pipeline. Being able to build modules with react in a theme setting enables you to leverage reusable components for field groups / subcomponents of modules (think buttons that are reused across button modules / cards etc) Basically just bringing react to your stack and all of its benefits. Server side rendering etc.
this still requires `Enterprise` to have `.evn` file for secrets etc. ? or we expose them differently in modules?

Enterprise+ is only needed if you plan to use serverless functions.  .env files are only used for serverless.

Projects feature itself doesn't require enterprise.

But if you want to use secrets for API calls I do believe you would be leveraging the same secret store as serverless functions. But as Jon mentioned — you don’t need enterprise to build react modules / themes.
HS react docs for secrets can be found <https://github.HubSpot.com/cms-react/reference/secrets.html|here>
